Class ConcordanceDataStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConcordanceDataStructure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConcordanceDataStructureInterface

    public class ConcordanceDataStructure
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConcordanceDataStructureInterface
    The concordance structure is based on a bucket hash table, where each bucket is a list of data elements that represent words found in the text.
    Author:
    Montague Nagel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConcordanceDataStructure(int estimatedEntries)
      Number represents the estimated number of words in the text
      ConcordanceDataStructure(java.lang.String test, int size)
      Constructor for testing purposes.

      boolean isPrime(int num)
      Sees if number is prime
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> showAll()
      Display the words in Alphabetical Order followed by a :, followed by the line numbers in numerical order, followed by a newline here's an example: after: 129, 175 agree: 185 agreed: 37 all: 24, 93, 112, 175, 203 always: 90, 128

      • getPageNumbers

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer>> getPageNumbers(int index)
        Returns all page numbers of the words in the "bucket" at the specified index
        Specified by:
        getPageNumbers in interface ConcordanceDataStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        index - location within the hash table
        Returns:
        all page numbers in the form of a ArrayList of LinkedLists, where each item in the LinkedList is a line number, and each item in the ArrayList is the set of all line numbers for the corresponding word in the "bucket"

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String word,
                int lineNum)
        Adds the word to the correct location in the hash table, if it is not already there. If the word is already there, the line number will be added to the list of lines in the word data element, if it is not already there.
        Specified by:
        add in interface ConcordanceDataStructureInterface
        Parameters:
        word - the word to be added
        lineNum - the line number the word was found on

      • showAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> showAll()
        Description copied from interface: ConcordanceDataStructureInterface
        Display the words in Alphabetical Order followed by a :, followed by the line numbers in numerical order, followed by a newline here's an example: after: 129, 175 agree: 185 agreed: 37 all: 24, 93, 112, 175, 203 always: 90, 128
        Specified by:
        showAll in interface ConcordanceDataStructureInterface
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings. Each string has one word, followed by a :, followed by the line numbers in numerical order, followed by a newline.
